content:
This chunk appears to be part of an initialization method in a Panda3D Actor class, specifically handling the setup of Level of Detail (LOD) levels and loading 3D models into the actor. It is situated within a larger code block that processes the creation of an actor from a configuration dictionary containing model files organized by LOD names and part names. The code adds LODs to the actor and loads corresponding geometry for each LOD, handling both single-part and multi-part actors with or without LOD support.

# this will make it easier to set ranges
                        for lodName in sorted(models):
                            # make a node under the LOD switch
                            # for each lod (just because!)
                            self.addLOD(str(lodName))
                            # iterate over both dicts
                            for modelName in models[lodName]:
                                self.loadModel(models[lodName][modelName],
                                               modelName, lodName, copy = copy,
                                               okMissing = okMissing)
                    # then if there is a dictionary of dictionaries of anims
                    elif isinstance(anims[next(iter(anims))], dict):
                        # then this is a multipart actor w/o LOD
                        for partName in models:
